name: Upper Colo
description: Upper Colo bridge in construction. Parking on the side of the road for up to 3-4 big rigs ok. At low water levels the river is easy to cross in shorts. Toilets, cold showers, designated camping on the other side of the Colo River 1.6km from the bridge. (Vehicle access from North via Hulbert Rd.)

name: Eumundi Markets Car Park
description:
Allows RVs to park for up to two nights. $30.00per night. $5 for electric hook up.
Showers and dump site.

name: Kendall Showground
description: Great, cheap little campsite. $20 cash per night for a site. there's power and water hookup, toilets and showers, and even a dump site.

name: Kendall Showground
description: small dump station near the camping at Kendall Showground. there is water to rinse but there is no potable water

name: Split Rock Dam
description: Lovely place to camp on the banks of a large dam. Many places to set up depending on the water level.  we camped in an open area near the boat ramp at the end of the road.  No facilities but there is a toilet at the picnic day use area on the way in.

name: Number One Beach (Seal Rocks)
description: Spent three nights parked in front of the beach without a problem. A very quiet area, calm beach (not patrolled). Toilets close by with cold outside shower and dumping point.

name: Tenbury Hunter Reserve
description: 500m from Swan Reach Ferry.   West side of river, windy and dusty but nice area for an overnight stop.  Had toilet as well as RV dump area.  😀

name: Banskia Camp 4WD only
description: 8 allocated camp sites; $11 per adult; $ 15 park entry fee; beautiful spot, 4WD only, reduce tire pressure

name: Tozers Bush Camp
description:
48 unpowered bays surrounded by native bushland. Large open plan country style kitchen for cooking and entertainment. super clean bathroom with hot showers!
$15 per person / night

name: Camden Haven Laundry Service
description: washer and dryers take $1 coins only. small laundromat so it can get busy, but it's the only one in town.

name: Mendooran
description: Free camping within walking distance to the pub. Toilets and cold water shower. Dump point.

name: Gilgandra Bowls Club
description: Free camping out the rear of the bowls club. No toilets available when the club is closed. The bowls club has amazing Chinese food and WiFi available. Free water and dump point available behind the Gilgandra Information Centre.

name: Coonabarabran Golf Club
description: Free camp. No amenities, must be fully self contained. Can visit golf club for beverages.

name: Camp Cypress - Baradine Showground
description: Paid campsite with cabins also available. Very quiet, water, showers, toilets and washing machine available.

name: Paceway Showground
description: Paid camping, power and unpowered sites. Old but clean amenities

name: Freedom Camp
description: Free camp but visitors are encouraged to make a donation. Pretty grassy area near river. Pet friendly but no amenities apart from a dump point.

name: Bulga Free Camp
description: Free camping on a grassy field. short walk to local pub, a beautiful old graveyard across the road. Flushing toilets, picnic shelter, tennis courts and kids playground on site.

name: Refugio de Vida Silvestre Chacocente (Turtle nesting reserve)
description: Rustic camping with a few shaded areas. 200m walk to beach on a good path. clean untouched long beach with no people and lots of wildlife. between August to Jan is turtle season - you can follow the park rangers around on the night shifts to see turtles laying eggs, or eggs hatching. There is also military here and they follow the Rangers at night (and guard the camp) so it's pretty safe. They are mainly here to guard the sea border but they also keep an eye on the turtle operation (government run). Park entry is 100C per person per day. we had our own toilet and shower so we didn't have to pay for camping. from santa teresa to the turn off is 20km of dirt road good quality but many shallow hard packed creek crossings fine for 2wd in dry weather. once you turn off the road which goes from santa Teresa to astillero, it gets really rough. there is a river crossing which was nearly knee deep, you need to walk it and drive over the Rocky parts, the exit was quite steep you need to search for it before you cross the river. from here the road is rough and some clearance is required. I made it in a ford E150. a tall van could be an issue as some parts of the track are not level and your vehicle will be tilted. Also very steep and not good during wet weather. from santa Teresa there are many signs along the way. It's worth the drive as it's quiet, safe and you can see the turtles.

name: Sails Holiday Park
description: Nice clean campground, sites are large, close to the Lake and shopping is only 7mins walk away

name: Albury Showgrounds
description: Camping at the showground big sites  with lots of room, you must prebook. Has power ,water and toilets. It is dog friendly. Call 0448452545

name: Nigretta Falls Reserve
description: Stunning waterfalls (if enough water), otherwise still impressive rock face with waterfall drizzle. Large deep swimming area above the falls accessed from the second carpark (otherwise an easy walk) on Wannon River. Free gas powered BBQs, toilets with wheel chair access.

name: Fairlands Beach Public Reserve
description:
Telstra cell phone signal excellent, 
Multiple spots available, Buses included.
No permits required for the area. 
Beachfront location.
Designated dog beach (lead-free to the west, on lead to the east)

name: The Granites
description:
Carpark which allows free camping.  No facilities.  Big bitumen carpark right next to the most magnificent beach.
You can drive on to the beach with 4wd.  
Good phone service with Telstra/Optus.
Good television service.

name: Staffy’s  Corner
description: A simple little clearing in the pine forest not far off the Highway

name: Dimboola Public Toilets
description: Nice clean showers and toilets behind the library

name: Queenstown Cabin & Tourist Park
description:
28 places for recreational vehicles 
11 garden places
5 cabins full equiped to rent
6 shelters 
Laundry, camp kitchen, BBQ
Very clean place

name: South Melbourne Market
description:
The South Melbourne Market was established in 1867 and is the oldest continuing Market in Melbourne.

Open Wednesday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday, from 8am to 4pm.

Park on roof, or (less than 2m) in nearby Spotlight Centre.

name: City Jeep
description:
Service, repairs and spare parts for Jeep and all Mopar vehicles.

https://www.cityjeep.com.au/service/m/service/

name: Policeman’s Point
description:
Free campground with pit toilet. About 25 sites right near stunning beach/mouth of river. 
Busy on holidays.
2bars of Telstra.

New toilets, but no other facilities - you must bring your own water and firewood, and remove all rubbish

name: Lagoons Beach Campground
description: Free campground with many huge flat sites, plenty of room. Ok Telstra reception in the right spots.

name: Glendambo South Rest Area
description: Red sandy, scrubby area in behind basic rest area (picnic table and shelter), may be a watering hole. Drive in on road behind rest area 200m+ for lots of level ground and some shade. 3bars of Telstra.

name: Pembina spuds roadhouse camp
description: By donation ($5 per vehicle 2022), flat gravel campground, beside roadhouse restaurant. Flush toilets, fuel, Telstra service. Showers closed for renovations , some covered exercise equipment and picnic tables. Near highway.

name: Roadside
description:
Parking close to the road. No services.
.....
Parking proche de la route. Aucuns services.

name: Banksia reserve
description:
3 picnic tables available. Parking 24h max. Very quiet and beautiful sky
.....
3 tables de piques niques mises à disposition. Stationnement 24h max. Très calme et ciel magnifique

name: Lockwood Canvas
description:
Lockwood Canvas provides made to order custom canvas solutions.
Everything from a duffel bag to a caravan awning.
Tent repairs and custom items of all sizes.

name: Warren Gorge
description: Well organized camp in stunning gorge. Small 5k hike is great, you will see yellow footed rock wallabies. No phone signal.

name: Chambers gorge
description: Follow a creek bed down into a Beautiful gorge and sacred site for the Adnyamathanha Peoples. Four official free campsites available alongside the gorge. 4x4 recommended, high clearance and a bit rocky for regular cars

name: Copley hotel and pub
description: Six slab sites beside the pub are available for patrons of the pub. There is also a grassy beer garden, and a friendly publican.

name: Farina historic township campground
description:
Really nice campground with flush toilets, shade and some grass. 
$10 per person or $20 per vehicle.
Shower hot if you light the donkey, you can buy fire wood here or BYO
No service

name: Edagee rest area
description: Wc, space, legal. Big aera for all vehicules

name: Clark Rubber
description: Rubber, foam, matting, pipe fittings, custom sizing and fitting.

name: Rose bay
description: 4 places with wc and shower. No problems with policemen

name: Owen Springs Waterhole
description: Follow a 4x4 road about 5km down to a waterhole along the (sometimes dry) river. Variety of spots to camp alongside. No facilities or reception.

name: Stuart’s Well free camping
description:
Dirt lot behind the pub/servo. Free, Telstra phone reception.
Pub has cold beer and camel pies!! Yum.
Also has paid campground for $10

name: Mt. Dare Hotel & Campground
description:
Pub, restaurant, rooms for rent, camping , petrol, diesel, all the things.
Camping $25 per vehicle with two people. Hot showers, flush toilets.
I’m told you might be able to get the very slow wifi password if you have something urgent like letting someone know you made it out of the Simpson alive

name: Madigan Camp 5
description: Madigan camp 5 crossing the Simpson. Nothing and nobody. Some shade, flat spots

name: Madigan Camp 1a
description:
Officially the first camp on the Madigan line. Nothing here, a little shade, flat spots and a Madigan marker post.
From here go to camp 5, the others have been closed

name: Madigan camp 6
description: Flat spot between dunes, no shade. Madigan sign for camp 6. Wouldn’t recommend camping here.

name: Madigan camp 7
description: Flat open space, almost no shade. Some wind protection from the dunes.

name: Madigan camp 8 (alternate w/trees!)
description: A large stand of coolibah trees offer shade and wind protection. Tracks on north side lead into several nice flat areas perfect for camp

name: Madigan Camp 9
description: Official post of Madigan’s camp 9. No shade, but flat. Windy at the time of our visit. Not great.

name: Madigan Camp 10
description: Small turnout at the official marker, little shade, not much space. No firewood.

name: Madigan Camp 11
description: Official spot where he watered his camels in a clay pan. No water around now. Flat, large area. No shade

name: Madigan camp 12
description: Another official camp with marker. Small, no shade, barely room for one vehicle

name: Madigan Camp 13
description: Massive open flat spot at the marker for madigan’s camp 13. No shade, but tons of space for many vehicles

name: Madigan Camp 14
description: Small turnout at the official camp 14. No shade. No firewood.

name: Madigan Camp 15
description: Camp and junction with the haha River track. A few gum trees, wind protection as you are in a bit of a dry river bed.

name: Madigan Camp 16
description:
Official camp 16 with the tree containing madigan’s carving - can’t read now.
Large area with trees in nice dune valley

name: Madigan Camp 17
description: Nicest official camp so far! Tons of space, tons of trees for shade, really nice spot between bigger dunes, highly recommend!

name: Madigan Camp 18
description: Another great campsite at the official post. Plenty of space, lots of beautiful trees and firewood. Lots of birds too!

name: Madigan Camp 19
description: Overlooking big clay plan, flat and shady spots, very nice.

name: Madigan Camp 20
description: Beautiful spot on dry waterhole. Lots of birds, tons of firewood and big old gum trees for shade. Open with a great view

name: Madigan Camp 21
description: Slightly off the main track, dirt clearing, some small trees but not much shade. Plenty of firewood

name: Eyre creek campsite
description: A number of smaller, flat sites are nestled up along the bank of the sometimes flowing sometimes dry Eyre Creek. Eucalyptus and coolibah trees offer nice shade and abundant bird life. Dunes provide good wind protection and nice sunset viewing.

name: Birds like caravan park
description:
Big caravan park with all the facilities. Very clean, hot and dusty.
Unpowered $20 per night two people

name: Port Julia
description: Relaxed open camp ground in reach of beach. Small town on the South Australian Coast. Camp ground has basic toilets and shaded grassy areas. $10au per night or $60au per week. Height restriction of 4.1m so suitable for most trucks. Generators allowed during day.

name: Mullumbimby Leagues Club Camp Grounds
description:
Local Council run grounds. 
Power and unpowered sites. 
Suitable for RVs, Caravans and tents. 
Toilets, showers and Hot Water available. 
Communal cooking facilities available also.
Clean site and friendly staff.

name: The Mucka Pub
description: Free Camping and Hot Shower so long as you by a drink at the pub.

name: The Red Lizzard Campgrounds
description: Clean site, good Amenities, fires allowed.

name: The Pelican Rest Tourist Park
description:
Good Clean Park with good ammenities. 
Close to town.

name: Peterborough Truck Parking Area
description: Roadside flat hard surfaced area designated for truck parking. No camping restrictions. Accessible for small and larger recreational vehicles. No services available.

name: Narrabri Showground Camping Area
description:
Well Maintained grassy area, clean but old amenities, close to town. 
Newel highway can be a bit noisy.

name: Glen Villa Resort Campground & cabins
description:
Cheapest around Byron. Very nice facilities, pool, wifi, powered and unpowered sites. Cabins and stuff too. Very short walk to town.
Unpowered site $40 per night

name: Wahba campground
description: Beach camping up behind dunes, variety of pullouts along the beach, inaccessible at high tides.

name: Ocean Lake Campground, Zone 8
description:
Official wild camp in the dunes for zone 8. Book and pay online.
Lake in behind is worth a look and swim, 500m north on beach is a fresh water creek to swim in!
Perfect Telstra 4g

name: City Lights Caravan Park
description:
Well Maintained, with grassy camp areas. 
Fires allowed in fire pits. 
Clean amenities

name: Speers Point park
description:
Big parking with water taps, toilets, bbq, and rest area. 
Slept here 3 nights without any problems.

name: Terrigal dog park
description: Car park close to boat ramp, scenic view and amazing whales watching tour.  We were so happy to stay here. Public toilets in 500 meters, Bbq areas and tables.

name: Hat head surf live saving club
description: Parking without any signs, access to the off leash dog beach, toilet.

name: Georgetown Memorial Park & Playground
description: Parking area adjacent to the town's park/playground that is also made suitable for overnight camping. Clean toilets, clean shower ($1 for 2 min), coin operated BBQ's and a water tap. Facilities are provided by the town of Georgetown.

name: Smoko Campground
description: Spacious campground with about 15 to 20 camp sites scattered around the area. Pit toilet and fire pits. Heads up: the turnoff to the campground is called Miley Ln. There's no road sign that indicates the turnoff to the campground. Free. Good cell service.

name: Karuah Golf Club parking area
description: Large parking area for approx 50 cars for the Karuah Golf Club. No signs that forbid camping but there is a no trespassing sign for the golf course itself. Onsite toilets that belong to the golf club were locked. No golf activity when we camped. May be different in summer time.

name: Parham Camping Reserve
description: Free Campground next to beach. Has free toilets, cold shower, barbecue and a book swap.

name: Tea Gardens Lions Club
description: Parking with 6 picnic tables, sanidump station, toilets and water. No camping.

name: Hervey Bay Visitor Information Center
description: Free overnight camping behind the Hervey Bay Visitor Information Center. Approx 20 parking spaces. Free wifi close to the building, free grey/black water drain, toilets inside building.

name: Benaraby Public Campgrounds
description: Public campground (rest area) with 7 concrete pads, multiple campsites (approx. 25), additional large parking area, picnic tables, toilets, water and dumpsite. All free. The 'no camping' sign is so people don't block the driveway of the farmer that lives there, but the main sign says stays allowed up to 20 hrs.

name: Acher Creek Rest Area
description: Large, grassy area with shade & rest rooms along side highway next to creek. Free, maximum stay 48 hours. Walks 7 some tracks in area. Several quite folks camped here.  Would definitely stay here if we were later in the day.

name: Elliot River Park Guthalungra
description: Roadside campsite around a small park next to the Mobil gasstation. Toilets, picnic tables, water tap available. Overnight stay up to 20 hrs allowed.

name: Bathers Paradise Caravan Park
description: Great place to stay! Clean and big spaces. Free WiFi and hot showers.

name: Water
description: shady spot with free water tab... not sure if suitable for drinking. Must boil water before use according to sign.

name: Kingoonya
description:
Was a busy town on the east-west railway line but now a bit deserted. Was the main road to Darwin before the road was bypassed and bitumened through glendambo.
Camping sites, great pub meals and credit card petrol bowser

name: Career Campground Zone 9
description:
Zone 9 official camping, must book online and book ahead, its popular!
Easily most stunning place on the island, breathtaking sunsets, very isolated and peaceful!

name: Bajool Hotel
description:
Free camping on the grass over the road from the hotel/pub.
Buy a beer or a delicious meal to support the super friendly and quirky pub too!!
Public toilets 300m down road.
Road and train a bit noisy.

name: Car Mills Beach Camping
description:
Government site, $12.50 per site per night.
Stunning, right on the beach.
Separate spots in the area for tent camping, camper trailers and caravans.

name: Lions Den Pub & Camping
description:
Iconic Aussie pub with camping in the huge grass area. Always busy and a good time, cold beer, great food, live music.
Camping $15 per person, hot showers, toilets.
Always a good time and plenty of people to talk about the cape.

name: Isabella Falls
description:
Camping allowed at these stunning falls! No crocs, fantastic swimming.
About 5 distinct camp spots each with room for a few vehicles.
No phone service

name: Musgrave Roadhouse
description:
Outback roadhouse with good fried food at cafe, petrol and diesel and camping on green grass for $15 per person.
Showers and toilets.
No phone signal, but free wifi

name: Rainforest Camping
description: Rainforest camp sites 1 & 2 in National Forest. Basic clearing in forest with space for three vehicles. No facilities. Must be prebooked online. No phone service

name: Riverside
description: Right on the river, great swimming, big space for 4 or 5 vehicles. Plenty of firewood. Even better waterfall for swimming just upstream- turn right at the fork just before here. Secluded.

name: Cockatoo Creek
description: Plenty of large sites on both sides of beautiful river. Great swimming, plenty of firewood

name: Nolan’s River
description:
Infamous as usually the deepest crossing on the tele with a soft sandy bottom.
Great camping both sides, amazing crystal clear swimming and swing ropes!

name: Jardine River
description: Camping right on the river where the old crossing used to be. Nice high bank so crocs no too much of a worry. Absolutely NO swimming. Good fishing!

name: Jardlne River Crossing
description:
Ferry is $110 per vehicle, runs 8am to 9pm.
Camping here if you arrive late is &10 per person. Dirty and run down, don’t stay unless you have to.

name: Alau Campground
description:
Right on the beautiful beach.
$14 per adult unpowered.
A bit windy, but plenty of options either on beach or in away from wind. Two bars 4g Telstra

name: Hamelin Bay Holiday Park
description:
Nice place next to the sea! Toilets and showers are a bit old but works well. No WiFi or cell. 

Nice place to enjoy the area.

name: Roper Bar Store
description:
Fuel, frozen meat, bread and others things you may need. Attached motel. 
Here you pay for the near by campground, 10$ pppn

name: Margaret River Tourist Park
description: Great place! Very clean and very helpfully staff. At walking distance from shops and the Main Street of Margaret river.

name: Bulahdelah Golf Club Free Camping
description:
Really great free camping at a golf course, plenty of space and fairly popular as a overnight rest stop. RV and campers aloud as well as tents and car camping. Big rig access as well. 
Unsure on official fire rules but someone was having a fire whilst there. 
Toilets free and showers for $5. Great mobile phone reception and pets aloud. 48 hours max at one time for a stay.
Nice and quiet and safe.

name: Leichhardt Falls Campsite at riverside
description: During dry season perfekt place for free. Officially recommended as a campsite.  Bring everything by your own, nothing there but sunset and stars.

name: Copperfield Lodge and Caravan Park
description:
Nice little campground with shade, 500m walk to Copperfield Gorge, 15$ for 2ppn unpowered. 
Historic Savannahlander train stops in town.

name: Overflow parking
description: Stayed here for one night. Quiet the whole night and morning

name: Campground shower
description: Campground showers can be used for 6$ if you are not staying at the campground

name: Bitter Sweet Cafe & Wine Bar
description: Great food and drinks, nice atmosphere Great Staff

name: Bimini Bakery Nate’s Specialty Bread
description: Awesome authentic Bahamian sweet bread! Really loved the cinnamon raisin swirl too!

name: North South Holiday Park
description: RV park with lots of sites. Also rents  rooms and cabins. All the usual amentities. Very close to the airport, with a free shuttle. WiFi for a fee - NZ$5 for 24 hours.

name: French Farm Campsite
description: FREE. Self contained vehicles only. No facilities except a few picnic tables. next to road, but not much traffic. Beautiful views over the bay.

name: Orton Bradley Park
description: Camping area inside a nice park. Quiet and scenic. Lots of walks around and golf course. Cold showers, toilets, electric at sites. $8 per adult, $4 extra for electric. Self contained motorhomes only. Tent sites available only in summer months.

name: Curio Bay Campground
description: Great views from common areas. Amenities need a serious upgrading. Walking distance to penguin viewing and petrified forest. No cell reception, no WiFi.

name: Clifton bridge free camp
description: Small grassy space for tents and gravel parking lot for vehicles. Next to a river and a historic suspension bridge. Basic toilet, no other facilities. Dump station in town. Free.

name: Milford sound lodge
description: Lodge and campsite. Expensive, but the only place in Milford to camp. Top notch facilities. Internet is satellite, and pay per mb. Ask for a spot in the back by the river, better views! $25 per person for powered campsite.

name: Lake Gunistan free camp
description: Big park next to the lake. Lots of space to park and camp. No facilities except old concrete toilet block. But you'll stay for the view not the amenities. Town of Cromwell is 2km away and has gas, dump station and several good wineries! Free to camp. Pack out your rubbish.

name: Wanaka Top 10
description: Great holiday park. Free unlimited internet. Hot showers, kitchen, dump station, laundry, spa and sauna! Cabins and rooms are also available. $42 for 2 adults in a powered campsite. 5 minute drive from Wanaka waterfront.

name: Smith's Farm Holiday Park
description: Nice campground on a working farm. There is a hike to a waterfall that has glow worms. bathrooms with showers and laundry facilities. A bonus is the wood fire common area with gas bbq. $18pp for a powered site.

name: Owhiro Bay Parking Lot Free Camp
description: Free camping in parking lot. Toilets but no other amenities. Max stay is 4 days. Can be noisy at night. Beautiful hikes nearby on the coast. 10min to Wellington center.

name: Samson domain
description: nothing more than a parking lot next to the freeway. good for a night.

name: Managhuia Campsite
description: DOC site in the woods next to a small creek. Seperate tent spots, covered shelter for dishes and cooking. Private parking spots for RVs. Pit toilets, but very clean. $6 PP. Very close to Mordor. Watch out for orcs.

name: Hora Hora domain- free camp
description: Free spot next to a lake. Has toilets, but no other amenities. Only self contained motorhomes are allowed, no tents. Very close to the hobbiton movie set. Free camp here a few nights to save up for the crazy priced tour.

name: Shakespear regional park
description: Nice big park with camping g areas, beaches and hikes. Toilets, bags, picnic tables. We'll maintained. $6 pp. Beautiful scenic spot to relax for a few days. only an hour from Auckland. No dogs!

name: Blue Heron Campground
description: Awesome spot right on the ocean, hot showers, bbq, laundry and WiFi. owners are super friendly and the wildlife is pretty cool. we paid $39 Nsd for a powered site

name: Uretiti Beach Camping
description: DOC campground next to an beautiful beach. Can be crowed in high season but still enough place, even a Saturday in summer time. 2$ for a rubbish bag the first day, 10$ per adult per night and 5$ per kid over 4 years old, free under 5.

name: Waitomo Glowworm Caves
description: This is the iSITE location in Waitomo where you can find nearby locations to explore caves and witness the beauty of Glowworms. well worth a visit! I used the Black Water Rafting Co which was nice, but personally I found the price higher than needed. the water is fun, but a simple cave walk is nice and cheap.

name: Tutukaka Holiday Camp
description: Campsite in Tutukaka, about 25 km north of Whangarei

name: Waterfall
description: Nice waterfall 15min of the road. Long drop of thin creek.

name: DOC Marble Hills Camping Area
description: Nice DOC camp site. Basic facilities. Walking tracks here also. Safe. $8 NZ per adult per night.

name: Centre of the North Island
description: This point is the centre of the north island. From the end of the gravel road Its a 300 meter walk to this point.

name: Gulf Harbor Car Park
description: Large parking area advertising that overnight stays are permitted. Great views over the water towards Auckland and surrounding area. Clean toilets and a free dump station on site.

name: Ti point
description:
Small gravel lay by with a sign permitting a maximum of 2 nights stay for self-contained campers only.
Running water toilet block next to the main car park, no drinking water.
Clear sea, boat ramp and an excellent hike also here.

name: Bluebridge ferry terminal
description: Interisland ferry terminal for Bluebridge (different to the Interislander). DON'T get off the motorway at the sign saying "Picton Ferry".  Fares, timetables and booking are online.

name: Freedom camping Wellington
description: Is a good place in from the of harbor and near the center .

name: lyell
description: a good place near  river and trees and track , toilets

name: Free campside
description: Nice place in from the off beach but don't have water, light.

name: twenty five mile streem
description: A nice place, with a good space for caravan and big motor homes. In from the road next to a beautiful lake.

name: Glenorchy
description: This is a place but is possible camping only day. Is a beautiful place.

name: Paradise
description: Paradise is a nice place with rivers and a beautiful views

name: Lakeview Holiday Park
description: It is a big campinground and a nice and beautiful place. There are many spots with view to lake and mounts.

name: Whangarei Museum, Kiwi House, Heritage Park
description:
Bird rescue center and other interesting tourist activitys here.
The Heritage Park has historical buildings and museums. There is a medical museum that has stuff spanning 100 years. The large Whangaeri Museum has live kiwis you can observe during the day. Also Moa bones found just 4 years ago. Special traveling exhibts, too. Can spend hours here walking the 28 hectors over looking the Whangaeri basin.

name: Ocean Beach Whangaeri Heads
description: Free car park site as found on Camper Mate. Only allowed one night. Limited area (maybe 4 spots). Will have toilet & shower but unfortunately it is not open yet. Just Porta potty now. No cell signal.  Amazing beach and nice tracks. Saw Gannets, Oyster Catchers, Tuis. Maybe Kiwis tonight! Dogs are frowned upon & not allowed. They are the biggest killers of kiwi birds.

name: Urquart's Bay tracks
description: Amazing tracks (trails) all the way out to the end of Bream Head. Really good birding. Can watch the boats go in & out of Whangaeri. Grab your beach stuff & head down on to Smugglers Cove. This coordinate is not the parking. No camping in the car park but has very nice restroom & water.

name: AH Reed Memorial Park
description: Neat place in the Kauri forest. Not really level. Hatea River walk starts here.

name: The Whitehouse Driveway
description: This place is a bit funky but a wee bit cheaper than the regular campground.  Good location for exploring the area. All the boat launches are walking distance.

name: Tapotupotu DOC ocean camp
description: Sweet spot not too far from Cape Rerenga Wairua, the top of New Zealand! Dept of Conservation camp $13/pp.  Good but steep dirt road to the camp.

name: Cape Reinga lighthouse
description: The very northern tip of New Zealand! Where the Tasman and South Pacific crash together. Amazing walks all around. Informative signs along the paved path to the lighthouse. You can camp near by & come early so as to avoid the bus crowds.  Backpackers start here to hike the length of the North island to Bluff.

name: Kapowairua (Spirits Bay)
description: Nice ablution block with cold showers. However camp is not in view of the surf as with Tapotupotu Bay. Once on the beach you can walk forever. Bring bug dope! $13/pp.

name: The Tree House
description:
A lovely spot deep in the bush. Room for only one small rig BUT can stay in shared or cabin. More a hostel. Can do laundry $8-10. Very clean. Lots of birds. $20/pp. 
Can backpack camp fer sure. 
treehouse.co.nz, (09)405-5855

name: Arai Te Uru Heritage Walk
description: Amazing over look to the heads of the Hokianga Harbor. You can walk right out to the edge. Huge sand dunes on the north, native bush on the south. Well worth a stop. The Tasman sea is vast.

name: Trouson Kauri Park Camp
description: Right next to a Kauri park. DOC camp with or without power. $15/pp without,$18/pp with. We'll look for kiwis tonight! Take the surface road in from the south even if you're coming from the north!

name: Waiomu Domain
description: Better have your "Self contained sticker" & stay between the signs or you will be fined $200! Cool spot. Quiet off the street.

name: Egans Reserve campground
description: Freedom camping with bad reviews on Campermate. Room 5-6 rigs fairly level.  Picnic tables. Off the dirt road a bit.  Had a nice swim in the stream with the eels. Lots of birds. Great drive though the Kauri forest. Stop and walk the tracks. Pit toilet (long drop loo)  looks very clean. No one here & it's Friday night! Cross fingers. No Zealand is packed with people scrambling for camps and it isn't even school holidays yet. Very restricted here. Cannot just camp anywhere even with the so called "Self contained" rig.

name: Coromandle Town Free camp #2
description: There are 2 freedom camping places in town. This one has a lovely stream behind it but is right next to the road. The other is quiet but all carpark.  Drunken people yelling walking by but they kept walking. Toilet is quite a bit of a walk. Okay to explore this old town with good fish n' chips. Nice walking to tracks to a Pa'  overlooking the harbor and town.  Picnic table right by carpark but use your bug dope. Lots of sand flies.

name: Thomas Burns Freedom Campsite
description: This is a carpark that allows overnight camping in non-self-contained vehicles. There are port-a-loos, rubbish and recycling bins and a sink with fresh water at the site. There is no grass and tenting is not allowed. Conveniently close to city centre. If you stay between the hours of 8am-6pm you need to pay for parking, cost is $5 per day.

name: Colville Bay Motel and Motor camp
description: Nice place tucked up in the hills near Colville. $10/pp without power, $12 with. A hot tub (spa) for $5 1/2 hour. Very peaceful. Laundry on site with clothes line. $2/ cold wash.

name: TECT all terrain park
description:
Only self contained vehicles allowed here. 

Huge Freedom Camp area in the woods. Kinda strange Park for us. Paintball, motor & mountain bike trails, etc. Thanks for the nice spot on the way to Rotorua!

name: Forsyth Lake
description: on edge of lake. on grass. very quiet. neighbours are ducks

name: Waiotapu Tavern camp
description: & now for something completely different. Park behind the tavern. Have a nice pub meal and a pint. Flat $20 per vehicle, not pp like every where in this country. Includes shower, toilet. Flat spots on grass. Right on State highway 5 so a bit noisy. Oh yeah, and it's behind the pub!! Electric plugs by toilet, scullery sink also.

name: diamond harbour
description: carpark which is after the harbour on the hill. short walkway to go down to the ferry to Littletoye

name: picton
description: parking in the center of city, on main street. toilettes. 5$ per day.

name: picton
description: campground for campervan ok for 6m. washmachine and drier. hot shower. near the road but very quiet during the night. 38$ without electricity

name: Glens Falls on the Mohaka river
description: Free or donation camp with beautiful grassy spots right on the river far from the highway to Napier.

name: Perfume Point Freedom Camp
description: Pretty far from town but walkable. Neat spot right on Hawkes Bay. Four spots. In demand even off season. Warm water in the washroom so could take a sponge bath. We got here and the slots were full. Hung out because we didn't really have a plan and someone started up and left. Yeah!!! There is a cold shower outside. Very clearly marked what places are Freedom Camps.

name: riversdale beach
description: small locality on the beach. very quiet. parking asphaltated. a lot of wind. behind trees it is ok

name: brokes place
description: near Hobbiton. small campground for small campervan or tent. the ground is not flat. 8$/person+2$ for warm shower. take your rubbish with you

name: Gannett Safaris, Overland, Cape Kidnapper's
description: Two tour operators out here to see the Gannett. One goes over land the other a tracker pulls a trailer at low tide. The overland bus isn't tide dependent. That's the Safari one. Safari is more $ but goes right up next to the colony while the tracker parks on the beach and you must hike up to the colony.  The hike is 2.5 kms with a gain of 500 feet. This GPS location is the Safari office.

name: Clifton Road Reserve
description: Really neat place on the sea. Donation please. Let's keep places like like this open! Lots of room no need to park on top of each other. Little spots in the bush for wind breaks.

name: Springvale Suspension Bridge
description: Historic bridge built in 1925 closed 1970. Road realigned with new bridge. Lots of room to camp. Big pool in the river but cold days for us.   Please respect this very special camp right on the river.

name: Taumarunui Holiday Park
description:
Great little family run place. A little on the funky side but better value than the Top 10 s. $18/pp with power.
Cabins 55Nzd for 2 persons, very basic without blankets.
Closed due to Corona-Virus the 22.3.2020

name: Piriaka yummy water
description: Springs here so good. While water is potable in NZ, most tastes bad.

name: Morgan's Grave camp
description: Freedom Camp right by Tangarakau Gorge. The Forgotten World Highway is full of history.  Camp by the bridge in a pull out by the toilet. Picnic table and short trail to Morgan's grave. About 3 cars went by on a Saturday night. Glow worms!

name: Dawson Falls Birthday camp
description: Right on the side of the mountain Freedom camp. No set spots just a car park at the visitors center.

name: Lyall Bay Carpark
description: Free parking on the beachfront. Next to the airport and exposed to wild weather. Public Toilets nearby.

name: Opunake Lake Freedom Camp
description: Wow an actual "Freedom Camp" where you are welcome to stay with Self contained, NOT sc, or a tent. 6 vehicles max 3 nights/ month. Good birding on the lake. Bonus: down by the beach behind the toilet is a outside shower! The campground wanted $8/pp for a shower.

name: Volca No View
description: Closed Monday and Tuesday.  Joeb came over and wasn't thrilled about anyone being there. It's Monday. He welcomed us to park but not open shower, toilet, restaurant. Hey, don't blame him only us. Another camper came in and left. Big rain, no fun. No power sites. We went to the Freedom camp another 5 k up the road.

name: Rotokare Freedom Camp
description: A predator free fence surrounds this place. Very neat walks with endangered birds. Saddleback & Hihi and more. They ask donation for camping of $5 but  please give more for this special place!

name: Ross's Dairy Farm camp
description:
And now for something completely different. 
Ross and his dog, Nelson welcome you to learn about the dairy business. $10 to park, $5 pp for a shower in the garage. Toilet is across the yard in the milking barn. No power. A unique experience.

name: Charley's Cafe
description:
Amazing coffee anyway you like it. Fresh baked goods. Hours 5:30am - 3 pm. We had right out of the oven scones, cream and jam (Devinshire Tea) and Mince on toast. Breakfast and lunch goodies. Dine or take away. Free WiFi. Really cute place and sweet as gals, Huia and Kahu. Ta!
06) 764 8722, 027)6172455, Charley's@outlook.co.nz

name: Unknown
description: Next to main road, large area to camp surrounded by sheep. We spent the night and could make a nice camp fire. Low traffic road

name: Ngawi Donation camp, Wairarapa District
description: Right on the ocean and last night it was loud! Long drop loos pretty clean IF people put the seats down! No water. Picnic tables if it weren't so cold outside. Can walk around the bulldozers. Did get cell signal. Neat place. Respect and donate please.

name: Palliser Lighthouse
description: Matakitakiakupe! An amazing place. Built 1897 of cast iron. The coolest lighthouse painted red & white. Lots of steps up to get to the 250 inside the lighthouse tower. Watch out for Fur seals on the road!

name: Whatamango Bay
description: DOC campground that has flush toilets, a sink for washing dishes and non-potable running water.  Cost is $8 per person.  The road to the camp is narrow and very winding but this is the closest inexpensive camping to Picton.

name: Havelock Kiwi Holiday park
description: Right in town but pretty quiet. $20/pp power, $34 w/o. Buck for a shower, no free time on WiFi. Smiths family farm so much better especially greetings with muffins, bush walk, free shower, WiFi. BUT that's 15 kms outta town.

name: Donegal House Irish Hotel
description: Thank You Murray & Pub people! Great food! We had the lamb roast & pavlova for dessert. Biggest portions so far in NZ and delicious!!  Free place to stay without power, $20 per space with power. Showers 2 x $2, toilets. Check into the bar when you arrive. Wish all of NZ showed this kind of hospitality.

name: Banks Peninsula Experience
description:
Great experience with the locals. Jan, Matt, Bree & dog, Ella's driveway. Don't just show up. Please call to book 027-586-9102, 03 329 0151.   janpoynter@yahoo.com
$30/ night. Some cool experiences out here like make your own bone carving with the Bone Dude or visit the gem guy, Vince. Matt Daffin also runs a motorcycle hire & guided tours.

name: Caroline Bay Timaru Freedom Camp
description: Camping in a carpark between a very busy Port and a beautiful park. See the Little Blue Penguins at night.

name: The Purple Lizard Cafe
description: Good coffee and fresh baked goodies. EZ Walk from the Free camp.

name: Takapuna Beach Holiday Park
description: Gorgeous little campground on the waters edge, electricity and dump facilities along with bathrooms and kitchen. In the centre of Auckland’s most popular eating and drinking spot and perfect for beach walks and getting public transport and taxis/Uber.

name: All Day Beach camp
description:
Pretty rough spot on the side of the road. Lots of muddy spots
 Nasty long drop loo with no door. Beautiful beach over the berm.

name: ATLANTIS Hostel
description:
a good place to stay, a touch of hippie, lots of paintings and colourful curtains around the dorms...young people, a generously equipped kitchen and common areas, layback and quite clean! comes with WIFI and breakfast, large dorm is at 20pp pn, upgrades into comfy bed (smaller dorm) is 25NZD...Private Rooms are possible too.
A GOOD PLACE TO STAY FOR A TRUE BACKPACKER!

name: Oamaru Harbour Tourist Park camp
description:
Spendy @ $50 /$55/ site but if ya wanna see Penguins, this is a great base. Little Blue Penguins actually come right into the camp to nest at around midnight. Can be quite loud! 
The town is worth exploring. Very interesting. Good bakery in the Precinct with pies and amazing sour dough breads. $2 for WiFi so don't know how it works.

name: Caseys Bay boat launch
description: Dunedin City Council property allows self contained vehicles to camp with no more than three rigs in a 50 m radius unless otherwise indicated. Parking on grass is not allowed. This is a carpark across from a pub. Pretty far off the beaten path. You gotta have your own facilities. None here.

name: Ocean View Rec Reserve Brighton
description: Freedom Camp with nice beach over a berm. It's on a busy road. Dish washing station, dump, fresh water in addition to the loos. 10 spots in all.

name: Hilltop Camp
description: Neat place, good base to explore for $10/ pp. Great big paddock so lots of space. We didn't stay.

name: Tawanui Catlins River Camp
description: Basic DOC camp. $8/ person. Water, toilets. Just a place to park near the trail into the bush.

name: Waikawa freedom Camp
description: Pretty cool spot right on the bay. Great place to explore. Penguins, Petrified Forest, lots of history and great bush walks. Large carpark can get pretty muddy.  Thanks very much Southland District for the facilities.

name: Bluff Camp
description: Nice facilities near the ferry. Not too full at high season.  Huge field for unpowered. Good walks. Handy small stores. Powered sites $25/ pp. Day use fee $5/ pp. Laundry, shower, kitchen, etc. Cash only in an honesty box even though, Brent lives right there and there is WiFi.

name: Mevlana Kebabs Turkish cuisine
description: Really good food for good value. Lunch special Stuffed pita with cheesy chips $11!

name: Hastings Top 10 Classic
description: Great base for wine tasting, olives, figs and the Gannets out at Cape Kidnappers. Place has a nice pool, laundry $4/ wash$4 dry, hot tub for$8/half hour. $23/pp. Little shops nearby. Big stores further away. After a few days Freedom camping we thought we'd treat ourselves.

name: Monowai lake Camp
description: Mostly tents but a couple of places for a campervan. Long drop loo pretty stinky. Nice walking tracks. Deep forest with lots of black flies. Bring your spray! Pretty place. Please donate to DOC box.

name: Manapouri Caravan Park
description: The cleanest facilities we've seen in all of NZ in over 2 months. The abultion block with kitchen, showers, laundry, lounge, lovely. The hostess, Gloria is not friendly at all but she keeps a tight ship. Very protected pitches keep you out of the wind. $42/ 2 people powered site. Top 10 in The Anau was $62! Take a flight with Fly Fjordland 0800 359 346. We did Doubtful Sound on a boat. Very interesting. Wait for good weather.

name: Te Anau Bird Sanctuary
description: Te Anau Bird Sanctuary has rescue birds of all sorts. The Takah'e are really special. Only about 300 left. The DOC people feed them and give a wee talk about them and other conservation efforts. Please be sure to leave a donation to continue these valuable programs.

name: Trotters Gorge DOC Camping
description:
a very nice grassy area in the middle of a forest close to a creek. access via 2 river crossings but easily possible in 2WD. Short gravel road ends at a gate with 7 parking spots - they closed the gate in order to spare the grass, so carry your tents for 15m ;) - if you are selfcontained/sleepervan maybe use the parking lots (space for 10 vehicles max.) - got pit toilets but no drinking water.
perfect for a night in the tent!
Don't drive a BIG car all the way up...it is kinda narrow after the first turning spot. 
Picnic tables but no shelter if rain.

name: Moke Lake DOC Campground
description:
if you are looking for a beautiful and quiet spot to camp near Queenstown you should head for this one. located on a lake (swimming), huge area for campervans and tents - you sure find a quet spot! gravel road in good condition even if 1 lane only at places. 
got pit toilets, kitchen shelter, running water. $15 pp/pn (honesty box plus there is a camp warden who comes to collect too)

name: Barnyard Backpackers LODGE/Hostel/Camp
description:
A beautiful lodge on top of the hill, they rent rooms (around 30-40nzd) but you can pitch your tent in the backyard too (it was fully booked when we came in) - the indoors are great, fully equipped kitchen with free tea & coffee, laundry available, hot showers, wifi. very comfortable lounge and friendly staff. (price pp pn in tent was 20nzd)
The views on the mountains were amazing, worth stopping by at this place!

name: Wildcamp on river
description:
follow the dirt road (we did it in a 2WD in dry conditions no big deal) until the VERY end (past the farm - close the gates behind if necessary!) - there is a tiny DOC "parking" where you can leave your car (guess sleeping there inside your van would be possible as well...) - grab your camping gear and walk the trail for less than 1km. After the little downhill turn right onto the grass and search your way down to the river (before the big bend) - there is a small beach (with grass to put the tent) covered with trees, a beautiful spot for the night, out of view, calm except for wild river. 
Do NOT use during rain season!
Alternative: hike up to the first DOC hut in the mountains, a good place to stay as well!

name: Gunn Camp on the Hollyford river
description: Historical camp that is very quirky. Davey Gunn, then his son, Murray ran the camp until just a few years ago. The place is the original Depression era family camp for building the Milford road. Many of the old cabins are still in use. Now run by a trust dedicated to preserve the past. Neat trails all around here. Glow worms, too. Funky place deep in the Fjordlands park. $20/ pp no power.  Showers heated with wood/ coal.

name: Crown Range Saddle free camp
description: Strickly self contained. No facilities just a parking lot with an incredible view. Lots of wind. At least 24 rigs in there by morning. A nice hike right out of the gate.

name: Raspberry Flats Mt Aspiring Park
description: Donation camp. Amazing hiking from here. The camp is big but may be very busy during the day with day hikers. Portapotties and a tap with river water. Covered picnic table. Horrid long dirt road in with so much traffic. Lots of waterfalls on the way. Self contained only.

name: Makarora Country Cafe'
description: Nice little camp for $16/pp for powered site. Great hot shower and clean. Laundry, kitchen ( very small) on site. Cafe closes at 4:20 so check in after that until 10 PM at the house out back ( duty manager). Camp is really just a side thing. The Cafe caters to tour buses from 11am til ' 3 pm. WiFi is 20 minutes then you can buy some BUT we never got it to work. No cell signal.

name: Jackson Bay
description:
Just some pull offs along the shore. Not sure how long this kind of camping/ parking for the night will last. All of New Zealand seems hell bent on eliminating every free camp in the country. It's sad. 
Please make the place better than you found it.
If you come out here, have some fish at The Craw Pot. Very yummy. Last order @ 7 pm.
There's a toilet across from the wharf.
There is no cell coverage.
We saw one Fjordland Crested penguin come to shore. Very cool & rare.

name: Okarito Community Camp
description:
$15/ pp & $2 -4 min. shower. No power. Basically a parking lot
 crammed in. No space. Two toilets per sex for 100 people +. Beautiful place with cool trails. They say they want wild kiwis and birds BUT a cat wanders the camp which means death to the shore birds near by. No Wi-Fi even though they give you a password. Lots of sandflies but that comes with the territory.

name: JACKSON
description: stunning little spot for fully self contained campers only...so NO facilities at all but beautiful set by the river with shade.

name: Pukekura Lodge population 6
description: Sweet as. Roydon and Katie welcome you to explore some true New Zealand lifestyle. Very laid back but brimming with information about the land, the people and the 1080 dilemma. $10/ PP Even if you get a power site. Rooms look really comfortable with bug nets. Very small place. Perfect.

name: Dulcie's Takeaways
description: Fish and chips shop.  Filled with locals because it's the best in the town.

name: Shining Star Holiday park
description: Beautiful place right on the ocean. Hokitika is not far. Glow worm Dell right across the highway. One hears the waves. $20/ pp powered site including shower and unlimited WiFi. 0800 744646, shining@xtra.co.nz

name: McMillan Road free Camp
description: Finally, at the end of our 3 months here in NZ, a series of free camps all along this wild west coast north. Right on the ocean, must be Self Contained. Please don't ruin the chance to keep these free camps by pooping in the bush. These camps are rare and tenuous.

name: Paparoa National Park
description: Here is the trail to Pancake Rocks and blowhole. Head quarters for the Park. Information board gives tide info. Toilets and restaurant, gift shop here.

name: Greg's Granity Beach Views
description: Very special place. Greg has set up a nice camp here. It's a work in progress. One cool camp people have done in New Zealand are "driveways". You park up on a spot designated as a guest. $20.

name: Kohaihai River DOC camp
description:
wow whatta beautiful place!!! Right at the end of the Heaphy track and on the ocean. Nice and roomy camp spots. Can park up right on the beach or in big shady trees. Only one other camper and a cheeky Weka who stole our cheese right from under us when we were here
 Got cell signal. $8/ pp.

name: Karamea Domain campground
description: Beautiful spot with powered sites. $10/ pp, $5 for power.  Washer$4. Walk way along the river right next to the camp. Cell signal. FYI can just buy a shower at the pub on the corner.

name: Cola Bay
description: Lovely free camping site right next to the beach. No shade.

name: Little Whanganui Camp
description: Nice place. $15/ pp powered site. $10/ pp no power. They'll give you shower tokens with camping. But you can take a day shower $3 each.

name: Hector Freedom Camp
description: Donation for the upkeep of the place, please. Look for the dolphins. Parking right next to the bridge and ocean. Nice to walk down on the beach. Bar just across the river. There is a cafe but not open for dinner. Great walking treks nearby. Store across the street closes at 5 pm. Please take your rubbish to the bigger towns. Water here is natural springs, can drink at your own risk, the locals do. Must be self contained or face a $200 fine.

name: Maruia Hot Springs camp
description: Nice pools inside and out. Sauna, steam room. A bit posh, especially the price. Day pass $40, $25/ pp NO power! Yikes! If you stay you have access to the pools for 24 hours until the next day 9 pm. Stay late and go to one of the nearby DOC Camps. It's our last week here in NZ so what the hey. No cell signal.  Beautiful river valley with high mountains.

name: Marble Creek DOC camp
description: Great big meadow next to the forest surrounded by mountains.

name: Deer Valley DOC camp
description: Pretty little camp right on a lovely stream. Can hear the highway. Just a  long drop loo no tap water. No rubbish. No one here. $8/ pp Would get 4 stars if not so close to the highway.

name: Culverden Domain Camp
description: Funky As! This place is HUGE. Lots of space but only a couple of powered spots. $20 powered, $15 non. Access to shower, washer, kitchen another $5.

name: Hope River Pies
description: Super good local made pies. All kinds. The main shop only open a couple of days BUT the Co-op has them just a street up as well. Yummy 😋!

name: Lytteton Boat Ramp Freedom Camp
description: Really cool spot with tons of space. No shade but a lovely breeze from the sea. Rubbish bins, water, toilet. Shower does not appear to work. Please take care of these places. Must be Self Contained. Make it better than when you came. Ta!

name: Sabbis indian spice grill
description:
Nice Hostel above indian restaurant where the food is good and cheap! Around 12nzd for a meal take away. More expensive if you eat in.
The dorm was very pleasant. Paid 30nzd for the dorm.

name: North wind lodge
description: Pleasant hostel close to the beach. Paid 32nzd for a 4 shared bedroom .

name: The Greenhouse Hostel
description:
Wanna sleep in a former school? Here you go...
30nzd in a dorm.
The owner was very pleasant!

name: Glinks Gully Beach
description:
Nice beach with strong waves. For good skilled surfers... 
Almost nobody at the beach...

name: Taste and See organic restaurant & shop
description: Organic restaurant and shop. Not that expensive... lots and vegetarian options. The orange juice is just AMAZING... one of the best in my whole life!!!

name: Backpackers International - Rarotonga, Cook Islands
description:
Hostel for low budget travelers.
$20 NZD per person a night in dorms. Can have private rooms +$.
No camping is allowed on Rarotonga.
WiFi is an additional charge.
backpackersinternational.com
annabill@backpackers.co.ck
+682-21847
Rarotonga backpackers may be a nicer place. it's right on the beach. we didn't check it out.

name: Oppnoni Beach Holiday Park
description: $20 a night, all facilities, some shade, near the beach.

name: Vaka Lagoon Tours
description: Boat n' BBQ, snorkeling trip. Get to wander on One Foot Island, and a couple other Motus. Saw the White Terns up close. Absolutely must do in the Cook Islands. The BBQ features homegrown foods. An experience in itself. Aitutaki's lagoon has to be one of the most stunning blue waters on our planet.

name: Atiu Villas
description:
A very neat place to stay & explore the island of Atiu. 
Jackie can arrange a Bird/ eco tour with George,  & an Anatakitaki cave tour to see the rare Kopeka Swiftlets. Can also get a taste of the homegrown coffee and bush beer.

name: Motupipi
description:
Grassground in front of kiwifruit platation.
7nzd pp.
No facilities but still nice!

name: Tutaki Bakery little Van
description: What a little bakery van!!! Bread is gorgeous and sandwiches yummy!!!! Good coffee tooo!

name: Glow worm dell
description: Only at night you can see glow worms! We were there at daylight!

name: Piha Domain Camp
description: Large grassy field. All size campers can fit. Common kitchen, showers, toilet, WiFi (only 30mb or 30min). All amenities. $20 NZD per head per night. Little pricy but only campground in town. Well kept. Skate park, kids play ground, tennis, basketball, bowling...

name: Rarotonga Backpackers
description: Right on the beach with a pool, too. A bit a way from the road. You mostly hear the ocean.  A variety of accommodation here from $25 for a shared hostel like dorm to beach front bungalows@ $130/ night.

name: Whitianga Harbourside Holiday Park
description:
well organized, clean and friendly place with lots of sites. quiet surroundings, near the water.
has kitchen good bathrooms, laundry room.

name: Allans Beach
description: Sea lions, a lot. after parking walk to the beach. To the left there they are. Just walk to the other side of the beach and see between the rocks on the sand. we saw about 12 animals. 9 sea lions and 3 seals.

name: Aroha Island Ecological Centre and Camping
description: very peacefull. nice track around the camping where the kiwi lives. at night they show them selves very often. The owner have red plastics for on your headlights to spot the kiwi at night.

name: LongBay Motor Camp and Cabins
description: Very nice Campground near the sea. With campkitchen, small shop and laundry.

name: South of Moleswoth Station
description: Up a rough forestry road, 4WD required. Outside of Moleswoth Station so camping allowed. A little bit of road noise.  The wind was crazy strong all night.

name: Free Camping Mossburn
description:
Along the Oreti River and Round the Mountain Trail
Simple place to rest for the night
No facilities, keep it clean
Toilet and clean water in town
Amazing sunrise and sunset
Take the Cumberland street, north-west of town and keep left to join the river and a big clean area

name: Kioreroa Rd Whangarei PDS
description: The destination is near the recycling station. There is also a drinking water.

name: Twilight Campsite - free camping area
description:
Only accessible on foot. Great for fishing, walking, relaxing. Before setting out contact the DOC Kaitaia office for an uptade on the conditona of the tracks. 
- Water from the tap is rainwater
- No rubbish bins on site
- Free

name: Maitai Bay Campsite
description:
- DOC Campground
- Adult: 13 NZD per night
- Potable water - has to be boiled!
- Cold shower
- Boat ramps
- Non-Flush toilet

name: Collins Memorial Reserve
description: Level parking lot with space for 12 camper vans just outside of Picton. Free spot near the ferry to Wellington.

name: Kaiaua Boat Club
description:
Freedom camping with toilets right by the water.
We were in a tent and camped 1 night.
Pub just over the road to get beer.

Relatively busy even in winter, 7 camper vans but enough space to each have your own space

name: Paeroa RV Center
description: Lovely tent / RV campsite for $12pppp. Hot shower for $1. Camp kitchen available

name: Cullen Hidaway
description: A good and cosy patch hidden from the gravel road. I found the space covered in high and soft grass, so perfect for a night in a tent. You can even see the Bream Head through a gap in the bush. Please, be very careful, as it is at the boarder of the Kiwi Zone. Leave no trace!

name: Camp Barker
description:
Sorrounded by beautiful native bush, there are a few spots along the Barker Road between Moir Hill and Ahuroa Rd. There is no "No Camping" sign, neither at the entrance of the road nor on the TA trail notes. We found a very soft, levelled and sheltered camp.
Please, don't leave any trace and enjoy nature.

name: Remiger Road Conservation Area
description: Open DOC space sorrounded by farmland directly next to flowing river. Toilet available, but was tipped over when we passed through.

name: Fishermen’s Bend Campground
description:
Nice and very natural campground. Toilets available but otherwise more like a wild camp. Spots directly by the river but also in forest available. Plenty of options...
Self registration at entrance, 20$ per spot includes two persons.

name: Hamiltons Gab car park
description: Bigger green area(car park) directly at the black beach. Kind of long way from Auckland (add 30min), but worth it. WC, cold shower and rubbish facilities.

name: Te Arai
description: Te Arai parking, partly for free, partly managed by Auckland Council (official overnight stay). Toilets and possibilities to empty toilet cassette. Nice beach, possibilities to surf.

name: Thames
description: Large parking next to rugby field. Overnight stay officialy allowed. large grass fields next to the parking and rugby field. Toilets available but closed during our stay 11/2019.

name: Cooks Beach Freedom Parking
description:
Cooks Bay and Purangi harbour are beautiful. There is freedom camping allowed in specified areas for certified self contained vehicles only. Gas griddle available for cooking under the pines by the river.
Come early, only a few official spots available.

name: Port Jackson Campsite
description:
At the northern tip of the Coromandel Peninsula, this campsite is right next to the beach. At the eastern end of the campsite, the Muriwai Coastal Walk leads up the headland towards Wharekaiatua Pa and along the coast, with stunning coastal views. 

We were lucky enough to spot Dolphins during our weekend stay - truly a great spot to camp. 

Access is via a narrow gravel road, but it is suitable for all varieties of camping vehicles.  

Like many places in the Coromandel, peak season (school holidays) over summer means spots will be very limited. November/Early December, we found it to be not so busy and far more enjoyable.

name: Pelorus Bridge South Isl.
description:
Stay either the established campground or pay $8 for the tent site across the road at a beautiful grassy spot beside the river. Swim and dive off the rocks to the left at sandy beach. West side of bridge has a trail with a suspension bridge. 
 This is a fabulous spot. Always room.

name: Custom House
description: Great hostel central location between shopping and waterfront. About $25 for a bunk. Good kitchen showers friendly atmosphere. Free wifi

name: Quinneys bush
description: Big campsite vehicles and tents. Really good for kids but quiet at night. Swimming hole 5 min showers. Was $18 tent

name: Rest area
description: Road behind has plenty of spots. No fire signs.

name: Trip Inn
description: Nicest hostel I’ve ever seen. $26/8 bunk. Pay a little more for 4 bunk. Piano guitar pool table free bicycles bbq good beds. Free good wifi. Best in town by far

name: Marahau Beach Camp
description: Ok place, almost fully booked in January when we arrived. $40 for 2 people, 2 motos and one tent packed in with everyone else. Kitchen and bathrooms are clean and nice, Wi-Fi is slow, or a beach but tidal water across the street.

name: Global Village
description: Anther highly rated bbh hostel. Beautiful carvings good kitchen bathrooms and rooms 32 four bunk or $20 for tent. Free bikes and kayaks guitar piano. Best in town

name: Trappers Rest / Kawhaka
description: Basic campsite free hot shower toilets running water fireplace drinking water free wifi $12 tenting

name: Seaview lodge
description: Old asylum turned into hostel tent and vehicles $15 rooms $25 and $45 deluxe kitchen etc. Great views of ocean 1/2 km away

name: waipoua campground
description: Excellent campground, former doc, but now owned by the local Maori tribe. 20pp to camp, 25pp in cabins, 10 for a guided evening walk through the forest past the Kauri trees.

name: Lake Okareka Campsite
description: Lovely campsite on the shore of the lake not far from Rotorua. Drop toilets, covered tables and chairs.  $15 pppn

name: Te Kauwhata Domain
description:
Authorised camping in the car park and fields of Te Kauwhata. There's a huge field for tents, some electric points (didn't check if working), 24 toilet facilities and a washing up station.  You do not need Freedom Camping certification to stay here. 

 The site is on a hill so views in all directions. Quiet place to overnight. $5 contribution recommended as this is provided by the local town, which has shops etc for most things.

name: West haven Marina
description: Campervan parking close to the CBD of Auckland. Need to have self containment but bathrooms and showers available. $40 per RV. Limited spaces for vehicles over 5m. Plenty of space for vehicles less than 5m.

name: Bucklands Beach
description:
The Howick peninsula is beautiful and seems to be free of camping regulations, so you can find lots of waterfront spots. All the locals are chatty and friendly. While I have marked 'no' to a lot of the amenities these can be found. There are plenty of public toilets around, places to fill up with water, there is a waste water station in Half Moon Bay, a  very good supermarket (First Choice), several restaurants, a Burnsco, pharmacy etc.  There is also and outside shower at Bucklands Beach Reserve toilets (near No. 45)  

To keep the status quo, we need to be considerate to the people who live here.

name: Tui Base Camp
description:
Tui Base camp is for tents and caravans and has even enough rooms on different levels. Nice public room and kitchen, clean and well mentained campground. Supermarket next to the ground.
For a tent and one person its 15 Nzd, plus 10 Nzd for every extra person.

name: Drinking Water
description: Water fountain near a Swimming pool. the fountain is inside the hall where the pool is.

name: Possum Lodge
description: Nice small campground next to the lake with nice owners. Cheaper than the other bigger campground. 38 Nzd for a tent and 2 persons.

name: Athol Camping
description: Small campground for Campervans and tents. Very basic equipement, small kitchen, no laundry. Powered for 2 persons 30 Nzd, unpowered (tent) 10 dollar per person. Very nice nature around, beautiful river just 200m away.

name: Howick Beach
description: A nice place to stop the night. There are toilets, which close about 10pm, a shower in the ladies and one outside as well. Relatively quiet night, security lights next to the coastguard station.  No apparent regulations to restrict camping.

name: Puhoi Pioneers Memorial Park
description: Small parking lot with toilet block, possibly locked at night, outside shower, good for Self-contained camping in Puhoi historic village, just across the river from the local pub, so shops and other amenities within reach and a short local walk (40mins) takes you to a village lookout

name: Dargaville Museum
description: You can camp in the park grounds of the museum up on the hill and enjoy the surroundings. They have the masts of the Rainbow Warrior up here. Its $15 per van and you pay in the museum, which has an eclectic collection, which we enjoyed. if the museum is closed, pay in the morning, they open at nine. There are toilets, open all night a d a dump station. There are picnic tables and shade if required.

name: NZ Customs
description:
NZ Customs at the Airport 

Open from Monday to Friday

08:30am to 4:30pm

Bring the original CdP, Passport and the bill of lading with you

name: Lakefront Holiday Park
description: Holiday Park for Campers and tents. lots of cyclists there, cheaper than the other campgrounds in Wanaka. 42 Nzd for 2 persons in a tent.

name: Geraldine Top 10 Holidaypark
description:
Nice campground with kitchen and wifi.
38 Nzd for 2 persons in a tent.

name: Rakaia Gorge Camping
description: Smaller Campground with a fantastic view over the riverbank and the gorge. Cheap, 10 Nzd for a person per night in a tent. Highly recomanded, maybe the best cheaper campground in New Zealand.

name: Rangiora Eco Holiday Camp
description:
Cheaper Campground with small pool, kitchen, nice staff.
20 Nzd for two persons in a tent, cheap cabins available. Internet 5Nzd extra.

name: Snells Beach
description: Certified Self-contained vehicles can park at Snells Beach carpark for a maximum of 3 nights. A sandy beach with views out to Kawau Island.  There are shops and restaurants in the town above the beach.

name: Sunburst Reserve Snells Beach
description:
Another Certified Self-Contained parking spot at the other end of Snell's Beach. There are 5 spaces available from 5pm-10am. External shower available. 

This is also the place people kite from, shallow and flat.

name: Motor Camp Waiau
description: Campground with affordable small cabins, 48 Nzd for two persons, in a tent 12Nzd person. Good internet, nice stuff, small supermarket in village, last one before Kaikoura.

name: Matarangi Harbour
description: Official Freedom campsite for certified self-contained vehicles. Nice spot on the harbour

name: Little Bay Reserve
description: Space for about 5 medium campers at the beach parking lot, for those with CSC.   Beautiful little beach with Pohutakawa trees for shade

name: 328 Campground
description: Small camoground with nice owner, chicken roaming around, a bit older, slow wifi. Cheap (30Nzd for 1 or 2 persons in a tent) in comparison to other campgrounds.

name: MacDonald Recreation Reserve
description:
Freedom camping for Certified self contained vehicles only. Quiet spot right on a stony bay. Probably good for fishing, some small trees offer shade. No limits shown on number of campers or nights allowed. No facilities. 

There are three DoC sites north of here (forgot to add them)  Fantail Bay, Port Jackson and Fletchers Bay. All great. Port Jackson has a long sandy beach. all have showers, drop toilets and water (must boil)  Port Jackson has a sheltered kitchen area with tables and benches and gas griddle for use.

name: Bulls Motel and Holiday Park
description: A bit older Campground with lots of Cabins. 17Nzd per person in a tent. Facilities old and medium clean.

name: 42b Hostel
description: Nice and cheap hostel with clean facilities, operated by a german family. Breakfast included. You can even put your tent in their garden.

name: Raetihi Holiday Park
description: Normal Campround with Cabins and space for campervans. Wifi only for powered sites and cabins. 15Nzd per Person in a tent or a car.

name: Eketahuna Camping
description:
Nice place with free hot shower and well stocked kitchen. Laundry 2nzd. 
Perfect place for a night before Wellington.

name: Small yellow and red caravan
description: Great little food truck serving great fish and chips along with lots of other options including paua. Opposite the old Tavern. We stopped at lunchtime and there was a constant flow of customers.

name: Pilot Bay
description: Nice free camping spot as the estuary meets the sea. Picnic tables. Nice and quiet.

name: Covid 19 stranded? Peaceful Cardrona
description: For Covid 19 stranded iOverlanders: We have  space for one fully self contained camper in the back of our property including power and access to drinking water. A pub and a general store is close by. Dump station, supermarket, gas station etc in Wanaka, 25 km away from us. Please get in touch with us before coming on 0212880447 or 0210614733

name: The Vineyard Driveway
description:
Great little place to camp in a paddock next to the farmhouse in a vineyard. Ruth will welcome you. Book either through campermate or call 0276306007 or email jackdavid01@xtra.co.nz. Please don't just turn up as this is a working farm and they only have space for one vehicle. $25 per night. 

Great place for visiting the surrounding vineyards and Ruth can rent you a bike.

name: Seal Colony
description: On the road out to the lighthouse there is a sign and turn off for Matakitai-a-Kupe Reserve. Around this rocky outlet is a large colony of seals. Be careful where you step as the multitude of seals and pups that call this place their home are often concealed behind rocks and it’s often incredibly windy along this coast. Give them space and try not to disturb them. Enjoy!

name: Totaranui DOC
description:
Lovely DOC site right on the beach and with plenty of shorter and longer walking options for those interested in walking Abel Tasman. The road across Pigeon Saddle is very windy and narrow in parts but usual family campervans make it so larger rigs should. 

Not sure how much it costs as it's free with the DOC pass. 

It gets booked out 6 months in advance in the height of summer (Christmas to end of Jan), so you may want to check availability ahead (+64 35469339. www.doc.govt.nz), but in June it was empty and beautiful.

name: Patarau River eachfront
description: Side road/track leads to beachfront field. Ideal for freedom camping. No facilities.

name: PuPu Hydro Wallway
description: A really interesting walk through the forest. A gold mining water race used as a sluice for gold-mining was built in the hillside in 1901 and the water rights were later used to bring the first power to the Golden Bay area in 1929. Walk the zigzag path to the top of the hill, see the penstock and follow the race the 1.7km to the river. The walk down offers great views out to Golden Bay, waterfalls and plenty of places to picnic. If you're interested in engineering and enjoy a good walk (just under 7km loop), you will enjoy this. You also get to see the machinery that works this power station and read about its restoration following a power short in 1981.

name: East Streat
description:
Multiple cuisine options with a nice overall ambiance. If you come here on the weekdays, post 5pm, there is plenty of street-parking available. 
On weekends, you may have to park a little away from this street.

name: Lake Alexandrina
description:
Beautiful place on the lake, amidst a load of classic NZ bachs.  We were the only people camping here, despite multitudes in Tekapo.  There is a gate on the main road and the sign says 4WD only but the gravel road down is well maintained and I think this is to deter most campers. 

Fishing on the lake (need a licence, available at the post office in Tekapo)  Basic toilets and a shower block - bring your own water/bucket. 

$20 per vehicle per night.

name: Patterson Ponds
description: Freedom camping along the Tekapo River, below the Tekapo Canal. Beautiful location. CSC vehicles only, although there is a toilet here.

name: McKee Memorial Reserve Camping Ground
description:
Large seaside low key low cost, camping ground.
Toilets, water, showers, beach.

name: Lake Poaka
description: DOC campsite for CSC vehicles, on lake Poaka, next to the canal. Beautiful spot surrounded by mountains. There is also Freedom Camping at lake Wardell a little further along the Canal Road which has a 3 night minimum.

name: Caltex Kurow
description: They will refill your gas bottles here, including the smaller ones as long as they are still legal!

name: Oamaru Top 10
description: Lovely campsite within walking distance of town. Direct access to the park which has an aviary, ponds, ducks, ponds (no bread just grain) fernery and play park. We really like Oamaru - everyone was really friendly, we got to see the yellow eyed penguins (go early as they come in about 2 hours before dark)  Also  had great food here (Badger & Mackerel, Cucina and Harbour Street Collective Cafe)

name: Katiki Beach North Reserve
description: A Freedom Camping spot for CSC vehicles, right next to the sandy beach.

name: Kinloch DOC Campsite
description:
DOC Camping right on the lake, beautiful views of the mountains, picnic benches, Kinloch Lodge for food and drinks next door, little pier for fishing. $15 pppn (adults)  

Phone and 4G reception here was surprisingly good. 

Further down the road, just out of Kinloch , you can camp responsibly i.e. freedom camping for Certified Self Contained vehicles and while there are not many spaces along the road to Greenstone to park up, you can park and camp the night at the Greenstone carpark where there are various walks, including the very beautiful 16km loop track to Rere Lake - highly recommended. There are also drop toilets at Greenstone.

name: Sylvan DOC Campsite
description: One of the prettiest campsites, well laid out in a flat valley, next to the river with views all around. Plenty of sunshine, great in winter.  There's a walk to Sylan Lake (2.2 km one way) but sadly it was closed when we were here.

name: Paradise Trust
description: This is an amazing place where you can rent rustic cabins and enjoy a little time relaxing in beautiful surroundings with great views of the mountains. Set up as a trust to enable ordinary people to enjoy a little of early pioneer life. Some cabins have outside fire baths which are amazing. This place is not expensive, and I would highly recommend supporting it.

name: Man of the Trees, Kingston
description: Camp spot for CSC vehicles right by the lake. Beautiful spot.

name: Waituna Lagoon
description: DOC allows camping here for CSC vehicles. Nice spot by the edge of the lagoon and the beach. No facilities.   There is a drop toilet at the start of the loop walk, which starts about 1km from here.

name: Brighton Domain
description: Free camping for CSC vehicles, right by the beach. Nice spot, picnic facilities and public toilets. Child playground and rugby pitch

name: Portobello Village  Tourist Park
description: Full Services camp ground. Great facilities and very friendly owners.  fully equipped kitchen, nice oven and laundry. close to the pub and cafes and a convenience store. Excellent wifi.

name: Waihao Box
description: Free camping for CSC vans, a beautiful spot where the river Waihao meets the ocean. check out the 1900s box built to ensure the cobbled beach didn't hinder the river's flow. Enter via Horsnells Road.  There is no bridge on the maps.me route we were originally given.

name: Culverden Freedom Camping
description: Freedom camping for 2 CSC vehicles. Grassy spot, covered picnic tables, playground. Right in town so close to shops and cafes. Dump station, fresh water and toilets close by.

name: Clyde Quay Car park
description:
A great place to park, leave your van for the day, wander around the city, enjoy a meal and then crash. It's $30 for 24 parking, and while there are free freedom camping spots further out, I think this is good value if you want to spend the day in the city itself. Te Papa is a short walk, nice cafe and free wifi, there is also a Sunday market next to it. 

There are toilets nearby if needed (closed 11pm -7am) and the Freyburg Center is a quick walk where you can get a shower ($3). Cafes also near Freyburg center.

name: Waikanae Estuary Scientific Reserve
description: Freedom camping for certified self contained vehicles. maximum space for 4 vehicles. no one here when we came.  Right next to the beach and the reserve and all the birdlife on the estuary. Kapiti Island looms in front. A perfect spot.

name: Cape Egmont Boat Club
description: Private camping ground right next to Cape Egmont Lighthouse.   $10 per night per site. Nice location.

name: Te Wera Valley Lodge
description: Great campsite along the Forgotten Highway Route 43.  Quiet spot, good facilities, would be great for kids - mini assault course.  Also very strong wifi. Unpowered site was $26 for two people.

name: Manawhero campsite
description: DOC Camp site just outside outside Ohakune. Peaceful location in the bush, next to a river with views of Ruapehu. loved it.

name: Jackson River
description:
Access road to the Jackson Bay River. nice spot on the water.
could hear kiwis at dusk. sand flies as can be expected.

name: Palmerston North Holiday Park
