description: Established campground on the edge of town close to public swimming pool, botanical garden and large sports park. Powered sites, tent sites and cabins. Tent space $30. Park is in a nice area.

name: Riwaka-Sandy Bay Road
description: Very basic paid campsite $10 pp/pn. Amazing views over Nelson/Tasman area. Hot showers, flushing toilets and an old food truck with a functioning kitchen. Water available. Plenty of space, close to Abel Tasman National Park.

name: Kawatiri Beach
description: Certified legal freedom camping spot for self contained vehicles. Enough spaces for 30. Right next to the beach just out of Westport. Toilet and sheltered picnic table.

name: MacDonalds Recreation Area
description:
DOC maintained camping area. Nice big quiet area with plenty of space. Next to highway but not too much traffic noise. Plenty of clean flushing toilets, running water, sinks, tables and shelter. $15pp/pn self registration. 

2-minute walk to Otto’s Corner campsite where there is access to the lake which is very nice at sunset.

name: Otto’s Corner
description:
Right next to MacDonald Creek Campsite and basically the same except the mobile reception is a little better here and there is lake front access. DOC-managed with flushing toilets, picnic tables and shelters. Self-registration ($15pp/pn as of 2020)

As always, be prepared with insecte repellant ;)

name: Cameron Flat
description: Lovely views over the mountains. Large area with toilets, running water, shelter and tables. Space for tents too. Heavy sandfly presence but the sunset is epic. Literally across the road from the Blue Pools carpark. DOC campsite - $8 pp/pn self registration. No phone reception.

name: Shower at Caltex
description:
Coin-operated shower at the Caltex gas station. There’s also a laundromat here with wifi. 

Shower takes 5 x $1 coins for a five minute hot shower. There is a money changing machine in the laundromat.

name: Te Anau Lakefront Backpackers
description: Backpackers Hostel right on the lake front, within easy walking distance of the DOC Visitor center so a good spot if you are doing one of the Great Walks or exploring Fiordland National Park. Provides dorms, cabins or tent space (although lawn space for tents is quite small). Has a laundry ($4 wash/$4 dry), good kitchen, nice outdoor dining and bbq areas, fast free unlimited wifi.

name: Cascade Creek
description:
Self-registration DOC campground, closest you can get to Milford Sound. Really big space with several pit toilets scattered across the park. Some spaces have picnic tables and is one of the few DOC camps where fires are permitted in the provided fire pits.  You’ll need to bring your own firewood though. 

One shelter for cooking but no running water anywhere in the camp. No phone service. No dogs permitted. 

$15 pp/pn as of 2020. DOC ranger will come round in the evening to check.

name: Visitor Center
description: Water fountain just outside the Mt Cook Visitor Center with two taps so you can drink or fill up large receptacles

name: Aoraki Mt Cook Visitor Centre
description: Large Visitor Centre with free wifi, water fountain, toilet as well as lots of information about the park. 25min walk from the campground.

name: White Horse Hill Campsite
description:
DOC campground in Aoraki Mt Cook National Park. Convenient location for starting several trails including Hooker Valley and Kea Point. Nice views of the surrounding mountains. Lots of area for vehicles and tents but it does fill up so be in early. Flushing toilets and a sheltered cooking area. Clean potable drinking water. Good phone reception. 25min walk to Mt Cook village where the visitor center is located. 

As of 2020 $15pp/pn

name: Lake McGregor Campsite
description: Large campground next to Lake McGregor open to vehicles and tents. Pit toilets but otherwise no facilities and no running water. Scarce phone reception. $10pp/pn self registration.

name: Charging Station
description: There is a coin operated charging station next in the lounge area of The Old Mountaineers Cafe. $1 per hour

name: North Street Laundromat
description:
Excellent laundromat, clean and modern facilities. You can pay by cash or card (there is a kiosk that dispenses tokens for the machines).. 

$5 per wash, $2.50 per 15 minutes of drying in regular sized machines. Also has large machines for big loads. 

Wash takes 15-20 mins depending on which cycle you choose. 

There are also a couple of power outlets you could use to charge devices.

name: Lakeside Domain
description: Free camping in a large recreation area alongside Lake Ellesmere. Tons of space for everything from tents to buses. Nice clean flushing toilets with running water taps. There is one cold outdoor shower. Max 28 day stay.

name: Coes Ford Reserve
description: Very large freedom camping areas provided by Selwyn District Council next to river. Max 28-day stay

name: Little Akaloa Wilderness Campground
description: Large flat camping site next to tennis courts with room for tents and vehicles. $15 per spot (honesty box). Has toilets but no other facilities. Family friendly. 5 minute walk to the beach, quite well sheltered when the breeze picks up. No phone service. No dogs permitted.

name: Waihora Domain
description: Big spacious camping area at a public domain, a little way out of Christchurch. Super quiet with very few other campers so plenty of space. $10 per vehicle per night (honesty box). Has a few picnic tables, a playground and a BBQ. Next to a DOC nursery. Clean flushing toilets and drinking water available. Pets OK. Good mobile reception.

name: Arts Center Free Wifi
description: Free Wifi in the Arts Center. Also here is DOC visitor Center and very clean modern public toilets

name: DOC Information Centre
description: DOC Visitor Center is located inside the Arts Center complex. There is an incredible Adventure Book store at the entrance with a very informative shopkeeper if you’re interested in hiking, mountaineering etc.

name: Christchurch Art Gallery
description: Decent free wifi at the Christchurch Art Gallery. There is a lot of comfortable seating in the lobby area

name: Klondike Corner
description: DOC campsite close to Arthur’s Pass Village. Large area with plenty of space for vehicles and tent with a few trees for shade and shelter too. Close to road though and a little exposed so you get traffic noise and not much seclusion. Pit toilets, cooking shelter. Self registration.

name: Public Shower
description: One publicly accessible shower located at The Sanctuary. Takes $2 coins for 4 minutes of hot water. Or take a free shower with cold water.

name: Lake Pearson
description: DOC campsite on SH73, 35km south of Arthur’s Pass village next to beautiful Lake Pearson. Pit toilets and non-potable water tap. Some nice spots under the big trees next to the lake but you’ll need to get in early-ish. Only downside is that it’s close to the road and quite exposed to traffic noise and headlights during the evening.

name: Laundromat & Showers
description:
Central Park Motorhome Park is located behind the Challenge gas station. There is a laundromat, toilet and three coin-operated showers. 

Showers are $4 for 6 minutes. 
Washing machine is $4
Dryers are $1 per 4 minutes. 
Machines take gold coins.

name: The Strand Freedom Camping
description: Certified freedom camping spot next to the river in Reefton, one block over from the Main Street so close to amenities. Two public toilets with non potable water 100m away. Must be self-contained.

name: Reefton SkatePark
description: There is a water fountain at the Reefton Skatepark that is good for filling up bottles and large receptacles. Skatepark is also epic.

name: Boyle Outdoor Education Center
description: $5 will get you access to a private bathroom with a toilet, sink, mirror and hot shower, without time limit. Clean facilities. Enquire at the office.

name: Hamner Springs Library
description:
Free wifi at the Hamner Springs Library. You can pick it up from the carpark. 

Open hours:
Mon-Fri — 12pm to 4pm
Weekends – 10am to 2pm

name: Shelter with showers
description: Public shelter has two bathrooms around the back with coin-operated showers which take $2 coins. You can change cash at the visitor center, 5 min walk away.

name: Hanmer Forest
description: There is a turn off at the beginning of Pawsons Rd near the recreation area for freedom camping. Good toilets 50m away at the park

name: Waiau Free Wifi
description: Supposedly there is free wifi in the area near the park and public toilets in Waiau, although I had trouble picking up the signal

name: Recycling Bins
description: An assortment of bins for trash and recyclable items. Next to the public toilets in Kaikoura town center

name: Kaikoura Free Wifi
description: Free wifi network in Kaikoura town center. No time limit, no sign up required. Simply free.

name: Ahipara Family Camp
description: A lovely campsite right next to the beach. Monty, the owner is super friendly and all very relaxed. $15pppn

name: Kaikoura South
description: Large area next the beach, secluded from the highway. Not far from the golf course. Spots behind the dunes or near seaside. Freedom camping, no facilities whatsoever.

name: Puhi Puhi
description: DOC campground 9km north of Kaikōura. Close to scenic bushwalk. Toilets but no running water (natural source only). $8 pp/pn

name: Cold Shower
description: Free cold shower in the toilet block at the beach on The Esplanade. Nothing fancy but there if you’re desperate.

name: Water refill station
description: Potable water tap and fountain on the Esplanade next to public toilets and playground

name: Marfells Beach
description:
DOC campsite stretched along Marfells beach. Toilets and cold showers. Non-potable water. Some shaded spots, some sunny spots. $8pp/pn. There is a permanent warden on site who takes cash or eftpos. She also has a book exchange! Phone coverage comes in and out but you can get good reception. 
Nice beach, interesting landscape! At the end of the beach are some rock pools to explore and a walk around the point to a lighthouse. Nice water temperature for swimming and good spot for fishing and shellfish collecting. You may be able to catch dinner from here :) Also, no sandflies!

name: Allied Fuel
description: 24/7 self service gas in Ward. Pay by card. Reasonable prices, cheaper than Kaikoura.

name: Picnic Bay Campsite
description:
Very small and poky DOC camping spot right next to the seaside. Only enough space for a couple of vehicles and limited grass area but it is quiet and peaceful. Trees shade you from sun and onshore wind. One pit toilet and a tap with non-potable water. A few Weka around. Good for seafood collecting, fishing and swimming at high tide. Spotty phone coverage. 

$8pp/pn self registration. Rangers do check in the mornings. Spent 3 nights here in absolutely bliss, because it’s so small most people move on without staying so had it to myself most of the time. Water temperature is perfect for swimming (wait for high tide), lots of native birds around, epic star gazing on a clear night. Pretty quiet apart from a little traffic noise during the day. It is an awkward spot, only just managed to fit my tent on an uneven patch of grass but worth it if you want to have some quiet tranquility away from crowds.

name: Nikau Cove
description:
Small DOC campground, just a few hundred meters from Picnic Bay with more space but does fill up fast. Close to seaside. Spots nestled in between trees. $8pp/pn

Note that these spots around the sounds are tight and awkward so may not be well suited to really large vehicles.

name: Showers at Punga Cove
description: Public toilets, shower and laundry at Punga Cove. Free WiFi throughout the complex also

name: Picton Library
description:
Nice modern air-conditioned library with unlimited free WiFi on the APNK network. Lots of power points upstairs next to seating for charging devices. Public bathrooms also. 

Open everyday, limited hours on weekends.

name: Tokerau Beach Freedom Camp
description: Nice spot down Ramp Road.  Loads of places to freedom camp right next to the beach. While there are restrictions in place these do not seem to be applied as there are people in tents, with dogs and clearly not certified self contained. There is a drop toilet by Coca-cola Lake and 5 regular toilets at the far right hand side of the camping spot, across a picnic field. Here you have running water and an outside shower. Water is not potable.

name: Free Parking
description: Free unlimited parking on Dublin St. Easily within walking distance of everything in the town center of Picton. Suits big rigs, trucks, buses, etc

name: Picton Village Bakkerij
description: Very good bakery / boulangerie / bakkerij in Picton town center, it’s a must visit. Open from 6:30am on the corner of Dublin and Auckland streets. Bon appétit

name: Twelve Mile Delta
description:
Large DOC campsite next to Lake Wakatipu. Several nice walking tracks nearby, such as Bob’s Cove. Easy access to the lakeside. Pit toilets. No phone signal. 

$15pp/pn, someone comes around for payment in the morning.

name: Glendhu Bay Motorcamp
description:
The most affordable campsite in the Wanaka area. Nice location right next to the lake, although it can get windy so try to pick a sheltered spot behind some trees. Gets busy with families on weekends. Good wifi throughout the camp. Clean, modern bathrooms. $1 for 5 minute hot shower. 

2020 price: $19pp/pn for unpowered site.

name: Picton Laundromat
description:
Good laundromat with modern machines that allow hot or cold washes. You can change cash and also buy detergent. 

$4 for wash. $1 per 5mins of drying
$3 for 2 x detergent. Machines take gold coins. 

There are power points you could use also. Open 24/7

name: HB Williams Library
description: Recently upgraded modern library with good facilities and free wifi. You can park at the end of Stout Street for free and walk over the bridge.

name: Kaiti Beach Freedom Camping
description: Free camping spot for vehicles along Kaiti Beach provided by the council. You don’t need to be self contained. Public toilets available and an outdoor shower.

name: Makarori Beach
description: Freedom camping for vehicles in the car park at Gisborne’s nicest beach. You don’t need to be self-contained. One pit toilet. Max 3 night stay. Not suitable for tents.

name: Wifi hotspot
description: There are numerous free wifi networks along the Picton waterfront

name: Dump Station and Water Supply
description: 24/7 dump station and supply of both potable and non-potable water on the corner of Johnstone and Harrison streets

name: Cape Palliser Freedom Camping
description: Camping permitted in this area along Cape Palliser road next to the ocean. Close to the road and very exposed to strong winds but would be ok in a camper. One pit toilet but otherwise pretty wild. Gets phone coverage.

name: Putangirua Scenic Reserve
description: Large DOC campsite at the head of the Putangirua Pinnacles trail, across from the ocean. Dingy flushing toilets with non-potable water. Nice landscapes. This is the most sheltered camping spot along Cape Palliser which is notoriously windy. Not far from Palliser seal colony and lighthouse. Self registration $8pp/pn

name: Putangirua Pinnacles
description: 1.5hr return walk via stream or forest to the Putangirua Pinnacles. Free parking and a DOC campsite at the trailhead

name: Dump Station and Water
description: Across the road from the Top 10 Holiday Park on Dublin St. Potable water available

name: North Tora Reserve
description: Freedom camping area on Tora beach front next to the river mouth. Pit toilets but no other facilities. Max 21 night stay. No phone coverage.

name: Tora freedom camping
description:
Camping permitted along Tora beach. One pit toilet. Sign says No campervans, No Caravans and No dogs but there’s no one policing that. 

Close to the gravel road so quite exposed and beach is very windy

name: Castle Point Scenic Reserve
description: Free camping in the upper car park for self contained vehicles. Right next to the beach with a toilet block and picnic tables close by

name: Castlepoint Public Toilets
description: Modern and clean public toilets with potable water taps and foot showers

name: Henley Lake
description:
Overnight stays permitted in the car park at Henley Lake park. Lots of space, cooking shelters, picnic tables a plenty and bins. 

Toilets have free hot showers although they are closed after 7pm. (One toilet stays open 24/7) 

Pretty spot, quiet and peaceful apart from the noisy geese!

name: Eketahuna Recycling Depot
description: Large recycling bins in the carpark next to the skatepark. Accepts glass, plastic, cans and cardboard. Free.

name: Oraka Reserve
description: Freedom camping site next to the beach on Mahia Peninsula. Narrow area with space for vehicles and tents. Campers can use this site for a maximum of 3 nights. Public toilets available. Good phone reception.

name: Free Wifi
description: There is a free open wifi network that you can pick up from the carpark outside the gas station/store. No password, no limit

name: Mokotahi Hill Lookout
description: Nice trail up the hill to a lookout point overlooking the wider Mahia area. Not too difficult and only takes about 20 minutes. Stunning on a sunny day - a must do if you’re in the area

name: Mahia Freedom Camping
description: There are multiple spots along this long stretch of road (Ormond Drive) in Mahia beachfront where freedom camping is permitted in self contained vehicles. Close to the road but in a quiet village. Good spot to see the sunset. Village with stores and public toilets at the end of the road.

name: Gore Bay Camp
description:
Council owned, privately managed camp site on the beach with powered and non powered sites. Kitchen (including fridges) and bathroom (flushing toilets and hot shower) facilities. Also has coin operated washing machine. 
Can pay cash or online. 
Note: no cell phone coverage here. 
Cost: powered = $30 /night (2pax)
Unpowered = $28 /night (2pax)
Single person = $20-30 /night
Extra people = $5-15 /night

name: Anaura Bay DOC campsite
description:
Large grassy campsite right on the beautiful beach at Anaura Bay, not far from Tolaga township. Plenty of space for rigs of all sizes as well as tents. Can get busy on public holidays and long weekends. 

No facilities except non-potable water and dump station. You need to have your own toilet and the camp wardens do check when they come to take your fee in the evenings. $8/adult, $4/child. Gates are closed between 9pm and 7am. But don’t let that dissuade you from visiting this serene beach even if it’s just for the day. Nicest beach north of Gisborne. 

Unlike most DOC sites, dogs are allowed here as long as you clean up after them and keep them on a lead. 

You may be able to pick up a little phone reception on the beach but there is no service at the campsite. Camp wardens have a phone for emergencies etc. 

There’s another commercial campground at the other end of the bay with a store, etc.

name: Café 35
description: World famous Paua pies at Cafe 35 in Tokomaru Bay. A must-do if you’re passing through the East Coast

name: Ruins
description: The ruins of the old Wool store are always fun to explore in Tokomaru Bay for a good photo op. Across the road from the historic wharf. Just take care and watch your step.

name: Allied 24/7 Fuel
description: Self-service 24hr fuel available from the Allied gas station next to the Four Square supermarket. Card only.

name: East Cape Campground
description: Small campsite along the coastline of Te Araroa

name: Ashhurst Domain
description: Good value, secluded camping at Ashhurst domain, about 20 minutes out of Palmerston North. Follow the road into the domain until you see a sign for campers. There is a small office where you pay fees. $7.50 for an unpowered site or $10 for power. Clean bathrooms, $2 for a 5-minute hot shower. Camping spots amongst the trees with picnic tables. Nice and quiet.

name: Motueka Beach Reserve Freedom Camping
description: Certified freedom camping spot for self contained vehicles. About 20 spots in a parking lot for large and small rigs. Not for tents. Toilets, cold showers, BBQ, picnic tables and outdoor sinks for dishwashing. Popular spot so it does fill up fast but has a friendly vibe with lots of vanlifers. Close to salt water pools. Very quiet.

name: Showers & Laundry
description:
Montgomery Superloo located in Montgomery Square has very clean bathroom, shower and laundry facilities. You can also find baby changing facilities in the Parents Room. There’s someone at the office who will take your payment and assist you. 

$2 for a hot shower
$3 for cold wash
$4 for hot wash 
$4 for dryer (up to 1hr)

You can pick up free Nelson City wifi here and there is freedom camping parks for self contained vehicles outside too.

name: Montgomery Square
description: Montgomery Square car park has a designated freedom camping area (or more accurately, overnight parking) for self contained vehicles only. It’s right in the middle of a shopping center so not a scenic or private spot at all but  available should you be caught out. Toilet and paid shower/laundry facilities close at hand. Free Nelson City Wifi. You must park in the area specified with blue marking. Not available on weekends.

name: Isel Park
description: Three spots available in Isel Park for overnight parking in vehicles. There is a sign at the entrance on Main Road detailing the conditions. About 250m in from there you’ll see the camper area marked out with blue paint. Best suited to smaller rigs. Supermarkets, pharmacy etc nearby. Flushing toilets and water tap about 100m away through the gate. Nice quiet area, scenic gardens.

name: Rakaia Gorge Camping Ground
description:
Beautiful, grassy campground overlooking the Rakaia Gorge. $10 per person. Mostly occupied by people with trailers here for the long term, but some tents and other passers-through are scattered about. Nice and quiet despite being relatively full. Site host is very nice and accommodating.

Day use picnic area and toilets available on an honesty box system.

name: Maruia Falls Scenic Reserve
description: Camping at the DOC-maintained Maruia Falls Reserve for self contained vehicles only. Large gravel parking area surrounded by nice bush. Waterfall 200m away which you hear as you fall asleep. One pit toilet but no other facilities. Good phone reception. No dogs, no tents, no fires.

name: Ocean Grove Freedom Camping
description: There are three little pull-offs on the side of this road where you can park a self-contained camper. No facilities and the spaces are tiny but incredible views over the coast. Limited phone reception.

name: Esplanade Car Park
description: There’s a car park on The Esplanade at St Clair beach where you can stay overnight. Nice area with cafes and restaurants nearby. Toilets and a cold shower in the car park. Some recycling and rubbish bins on the water front. Drinking water tap about 150m walk away. Despite being close to the street it is quiet at night especially once the restaurant patrons leave. Fall asleep to the sound of crashing waves. Around the corner by the cafes you can pick up free wifi.

name: Pinders Pond
description: Large freedom camping spot next to a pond. Tons of space accessible to vehicles and tents but only one toilet.  Pet friendly. Good phone reception.

name: www.wash
description: Laundromat and Internet access (no wifi though). $4 for wash and $4 for 1 hour drying. Open 8:30am - 7pm daily. The shop next door (Ula) can change coins for you everyday except Sunday.

name: Bungy Center Carpark
description: A dozen or so parking spaces for self contained vehicles to stay overnight for free. Large carpark just off the road outside the AJ Hackett Bungy Jump. You do get a bit of traffic noise but it’s not too busy. Scenic views next to the river. One portaloo. A little phone reception.

name: Free Parking
description: 4hrs free parking by the lakeside. Not a whole lot of spaces but close enough to walk into the city centre. Public toilets also nearby

name: Dump station
description: Public dump station and drinking water just outside the Lakeview Holiday Park

name: Lake Hawea
description: Pull off the highway next to the lake and there is a small but beautiful area for camping overnight in vehicles. One pit toilet but no other facilities and very little phone reception. There are signs warning you not to camp on the beach to protect wildlife (the sand is very soft anyway so stick to the gravel). A bit of road noise during the day but beautifully quiet at night with magic views of Lake Hawea and the mountains. Not sure how suitable it would be for big rigs but ok for vans. Enjoy.

name: Caltex Wānaka
description: Caltex will fill up your LPG tanks on the spot, large or small

name: Fire ring spot close to paragliding platform
description:
This is a tree free space just off the road leading up to the paragliding platform. No view from here, but it is a bit more private.
Fire ring, but be aware of fire restrictions in summer.
Cell service available. no other facilities. road is in good condition, no 4x4 or high clearance needed

name: Tucker Bar & Eater
description: Great food and drinks at this small and friendly restaurant. Tirau is quite a touristy town, this place was full of locals. They know where to eat.  Fresh and tasty.

name: Waikete Valley Thermal Pools
description:
Nice little campground with powered, non-powered and tent sites. Small kitchen and toilets at site, showers at the pool- area.
Camping includes unlimited use of the outside public pools (natural mineral water out of a boiling spring)
Powered: 32,- NZD/pp
Non-powered: 27,- NZD/pp

name: Hannahs Clearing...
description: Quite,hidden spot at the beach! No facilities,no water,no toilets! Freedom camping just for selfcontained vehicles only!

name: Tokerau beach / Rotopokaka lake
description: nice place at the beach. freedom camping allowed,csc!

name: Wastebusters
description: Wastebusters is an excellent recycling depot and second hand store where you can drop off goods and pick up lots of different things at very good prices. Clothing, homeware, ski gear, bicycles, sports and camping equipment, timber, scrap metal, you name it. Open 9am - 5pm every day.

name: The Washstation
description:
The Washstation has self service coin operated laundromats at the back of the car wash station. There is a money changing machine to get $1 or $2 coins for the washers and dryers. You can also buy laundry powder for $2. 

Washers $5 small / $10 large 
Dryers $5 

Clean, modern facilities. Open 6am - 10pm daily.

name: Timaru Creek
description: Certified SC freedom camping spot on the edge of Lake Hawea. Follow the gravel road around the east side of the lake past Lake Hawea station until you see a sign for Picnic & Camping Area. Lots of space nestled in under gum trees with pit toilets (bring your own loo paper) and fire pits. Beautiful spot, incredibly quiet and great for stargazing. Good phone reception. Due to the terrain NOT recommended on wet/muddy days.

name: Mt Kakepuku
description:
Free campground for SC véhicules, no tents allowed you must be fully self sufficient. 
Quiet parking  lot at the entry of a 1h30 walk to the summit of mount kakepuku. 
Bathrooms are located 30meters into the walk. 
You can stay a maximum of 3 nights in a 30 days period. 
No water, good cellphone reception. 
Alright for a night.

name: Riverside
description: Great site. Very quiet on a lake with great views. Made a campfire. Noboy bothered us. There is a restroom as well. Highly recommended.
